results.title: Victorian education history. - No. 1.
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Three programs which show different periods of school life in Victoria. “A Day at Ascot-Vale School no. 2608” is a silent film showing some of the daily activities at a primary school in the twenties. The second film is silent and untitled, but shows life at a primary school in the 40’s or 50’s. The third film is similarly untitled but is in colour and with sound. It shows different aspects of teaching in Victoria in the 50’s, with a substantial section on teacher training and country schools. “Each one is different” introduces the concept of child-centred education in Victorian schools.

NFSA description:

1. Portrays the outdoor life at a school in Melbourne in the 1920’s. Shows school dress, assembly, physical training organised dancing and games, Junior Red Cross activities, mothers club and school committee. #2. Shows the then new facilities for infant children at South West Brunswick Primary School. #3. A teacher recruitment film for the Victorian Education Dept. Describes the training of primary teachers. #4. Aims to show how individual differences in children can be catered for in a primary school physical education program. Describes the basic skills of gymnastics and the techniques of supporting, transferring and managing the body weight through different activities.

results.title: Victorian cast iron
results.creator_credit: Edward Hayward, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A look at some of the remains of Victorian cast iron in Great Britain, and some earlier examples with some discussion as to why they are important and representative of the period. Cast iron has survived better than any of the other new materials discussed, although much was lost for scrap during the wars, and many important monuments are being pulled down yearly.

results.title: Victoria University Student Collection 2001
results.brief_description:
CD ROM work provided by Victoria University of exemplary work produced by students in their multimedia courses.

This interactive CD Rom and website documentary explores the life and music of virtuoso guitarist Slava Grigoryan.

The website and CD ROM hybrid allows for regular updates and particularly suited to the work as the guitarist travels frequently and can list concert and publication updates.

results.title: Victoria changing faces changing places
results.brief_description: This short documentary addresses the issues that surround Victoria’s growing population, whilst also probing the past and how migration helped shaped the current demographic. Using voice-over narration, this features an array of archival footage to examine the underlying drivers of population growth, with a view to understanding how the community is changing, and the what the future is likely to hold for Victoria.

results.title: Victor/Victoria
results.creator_credit: Blake Edwards, Tony Adams, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Ladbroke Entertainment
results.brief_description: Sparkling, ultra-sophisticated entertainment from Blake Edwards. This story is based on a 1933 German comedy film “Viktor und Viktoria” written and directed by Rheinhold Schunzel. Set in Paris in 1934, it is the tale of a down-on-her luck chanteuse, played by Julie Andrews. Also suffering a temporary career lapse is tres gai nightclub entertainer (Robert Preston), who remakes her as a man who in short order becomes celebrated as Paris’s foremost female impersonator. In the process she snags the attentions of a Chicago nightclub owner (James Garner). He, however, has a small problem - is it a he or a she who has stolen his heart? 1982 Academy Award for Best Original Score (Henry Mancini). Academy Award nominations for Best Actress (Julie Andrews), Supporting Actor (Robert Preston), Supporting Actress (Lesley Anne Warren), Screenplay Adaptation, Costume Design and Art Direction.

results.title: Victimised, Assimalised, Correctionalised
results.creator_credit: Howard Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As a child, Howard Edwards was shunted from orphanage to orphanage. Made a ward of the state in 1956, he was abused and beaten wherever he was sent. His incarceration didn’t end there and for much of his adult life Howard was a target for police and he was often locked up at the slightest provocation. A large part of Howard’s journey towards healing involved reconnecting with his family, his work in the community and on the board of the Aboriginal Health Care Service.

results.title: Victim
results.creator_credit: Basil Dearden, Michael Relph and Parkway Films
results.brief_description: Dirk Bogarde stars as Melville Farr, a successful lawyer in this film which caused a sensation at its original release. Farr is approached by police who are looking into the theft of money they suspect is being used as payment for blackmail by Jack Barrett (Peter McEnery). Farr initially denies knowing about Barrett because of their previous homosexual relations. Barrett eventually chooses suicide over disclosing the affair and Farr guiltily takes a personal interest in locating the blackmailer. He discovers that Barrett was not the only one being blackmailed, and Barrett must decide between exposing his homosexuality and threatening his career or challenging the legal system that decreed homosexuality a criminal offence and bringing Barrett’s blackmailers to justice. Screenplay by Janet Green and John McCormick. Cast also includes Sylvia Syms, Dennis Price, Anthony Nicholls and Peter McEnery.

results.title: Vicki (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A documentary approach to the problems encountered by Vicki, born without arms, and her ways of coping with work, family and her desires for marriage and a family. Produced for television as an introduction to social services available from Government agencies.
